storyTitle: As Support Analyst, I want to understand validation error messages to assist users effectively

functional.title: Verify support analyst can access validation error documentation from knowledge base
preconditions: Support analyst is logged into the support knowledge base system with valid credentials
Validation error documentation has been published and is available in the knowledge base
Support analyst has 'Read' permissions for documentation section
Browser is Chrome version 90 or higher

steps.action: Navigate to the support knowledge base homepage
steps.expectedResult: Knowledge base homepage loads successfully with search bar and navigation menu visible

steps.action: Click on 'Documentation' menu item in the left navigation panel
steps.expectedResult: Documentation section expands showing subcategories including 'Validation Errors'

steps.action: Click on 'Validation Errors' subcategory link
steps.expectedResult: Validation error documentation page loads displaying list of common validation errors with descriptions

steps.action: Verify the page contains sections for 'Common Validation Errors', 'Causes', and 'Troubleshooting Steps'
steps.expectedResult: All three sections are visible with organized content, proper headings, and formatted text

steps.action: Click on the first validation error entry 'Invalid Email Format Error'
steps.expectedResult: Detailed explanation expands showing error code, description, common causes, and step-by-step resolution instructions

postconditions: Support analyst remains logged into the knowledge base system
Validation error documentation page remains open for reference
Page view is logged in system analytics for tracking documentation usage

functional.title: Verify support analyst can search for specific validation error by error code
preconditions: Support analyst is logged into the knowledge base with active session
Validation error documentation contains at least 10 documented error codes
Search functionality is enabled and indexed for validation errors
Support analyst has received a user query with error code 'VAL-ERR-1001'

steps.action: Click on the search bar at the top of the knowledge base interface
steps.expectedResult: Search bar becomes active with cursor blinking and placeholder text 'Search documentation...'

steps.action: Type 'VAL-ERR-1001' into the search bar
steps.expectedResult: Auto-suggest dropdown appears showing matching results including 'VAL-ERR-1001: Invalid Date Format'

steps.action: Press Enter key or click the search icon button
steps.expectedResult: Search results page displays showing 'VAL-ERR-1001' as the top result with highlighted error code

steps.action: Click on the 'VAL-ERR-1001: Invalid Date Format' search result
steps.expectedResult: Detailed error documentation page opens showing error description, common causes (3 listed), and 5 troubleshooting steps with screenshots

steps.action: Scroll down to view the 'Resolution Steps' section
steps.expectedResult: Step-by-step resolution instructions are displayed with numbered steps, expected format examples, and links to related documentation

postconditions: Search query 'VAL-ERR-1001' is logged in search analytics
Support analyst can bookmark the page for quick future reference
Related articles section shows 3-5 similar validation error documents

functional.title: Verify support analyst can guide user through resolution steps using documented troubleshooting guide
preconditions: Support analyst has accessed validation error documentation for 'VAL-ERR-2005: Required Field Missing'
Support analyst is on an active support call or chat with a user experiencing the validation error
Documentation includes step-by-step troubleshooting guide with screenshots
Support ticket system is open in a separate browser tab

steps.action: Read the 'Error Description' section for 'VAL-ERR-2005' in the documentation
steps.expectedResult: Clear description states: 'This error occurs when a mandatory field is left empty during form submission. Common fields include Email, Username, and Password.'

steps.action: Review the 'Common Causes' section listing 3 causes
steps.expectedResult: Three causes are listed: '1. User skipped required field, 2. Field validation not triggered, 3. Browser autofill failed to populate field'

steps.action: Follow 'Troubleshooting Steps' section and instruct user to check Step 1: 'Verify all fields marked with red asterisk (*) are filled'
steps.expectedResult: Documentation provides clear instruction with screenshot showing required field indicators

steps.action: Guide user through Step 2: 'Clear browser cache and refresh the form page'
steps.expectedResult: Documentation includes browser-specific cache clearing instructions for Chrome, Firefox, and Safari

steps.action: If issue persists, follow Step 3: 'Try submitting form in incognito/private browsing mode'
steps.expectedResult: Documentation explains how to open incognito mode with keyboard shortcuts for different browsers

steps.action: Document the resolution in the support ticket using the 'Resolution Template' provided in documentation
steps.expectedResult: Template section provides copy-paste text: 'Issue resolved by [action taken]. Error VAL-ERR-2005 cleared after [specific step].'

postconditions: User's validation error is resolved and form submission succeeds
Support ticket is updated with resolution details and error code reference
Support analyst marks the documentation as 'Helpful' using feedback button
Average resolution time is tracked and logged for metrics reporting

functional.title: Verify support analyst can access validation error documentation on mobile device during field support
preconditions: Support analyst is logged into knowledge base mobile app on iOS or Android device
Mobile device has active internet connection (WiFi or cellular data)
Validation error documentation is mobile-responsive and optimized
Support analyst has 'Mobile Access' permission enabled

steps.action: Open the knowledge base mobile app and tap on the menu icon (hamburger menu) in top-left corner
steps.expectedResult: Navigation menu slides out from left showing 'Documentation', 'Search', 'Recent', and 'Favorites' options

steps.action: Tap on 'Documentation' menu item
steps.expectedResult: Documentation categories list appears with 'Validation Errors' category visible and tappable

steps.action: Tap on 'Validation Errors' category
steps.expectedResult: List of validation errors loads in mobile-optimized view with error codes and brief descriptions

steps.action: Tap on 'VAL-ERR-3010: Invalid Phone Number Format' entry
steps.expectedResult: Full error documentation opens with collapsible sections for 'Description', 'Causes', and 'Resolution Steps', formatted for mobile screen

steps.action: Tap on 'Resolution Steps' section to expand it
steps.expectedResult: Section expands showing 4 numbered steps with mobile-friendly formatting, readable text size, and tap-to-zoom images

postconditions: Support analyst can scroll through documentation smoothly on mobile device
Documentation remains accessible offline if previously cached
Mobile access is logged for usage analytics

functional.title: Verify support team lead can track documentation usage metrics and support efficiency improvements
preconditions: Support team lead is logged in with 'Manager' role and analytics access permissions
Validation error documentation has been live for at least 30 days
Support ticket system is integrated with knowledge base for tracking
At least 50 support tickets related to validation errors have been resolved

steps.action: Navigate to 'Analytics Dashboard' from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Analytics dashboard loads showing overview metrics including 'Documentation Views', 'Average Resolution Time', and 'First-Contact Resolution Rate'

steps.action: Click on 'Validation Error Documentation' filter in the reports section
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates to show metrics specific to validation error documentation: 250 total views, 45 unique users, 180 search queries

steps.action: Review the 'Average Resolution Time' chart comparing 30 days before and after documentation launch
steps.expectedResult: Chart displays 20% reduction in average resolution time: from 25 minutes to 20 minutes for validation error tickets

steps.action: Click on 'First-Contact Resolution Rate' metric tile
steps.expectedResult: Detailed breakdown shows improvement from 65% to 78% first-contact resolution for validation error tickets

steps.action: Scroll to 'Most Accessed Documentation' section
steps.expectedResult: Top 5 validation errors are listed with view counts: VAL-ERR-1001 (45 views), VAL-ERR-2005 (38 views), VAL-ERR-3010 (32 views)

steps.action: Click 'Export Report' button to generate PDF report
steps.expectedResult: PDF report downloads containing all metrics, charts, and success indicators for stakeholder review

postconditions: Support team lead has quantitative data showing 20% reduction in resolution time
Report is saved and can be shared with management for success validation
Metrics are updated in real-time as more tickets are resolved
Team lead can identify which validation errors need additional documentation

negative.title: Verify appropriate error handling when support analyst attempts to access documentation without proper permissions
preconditions: Support analyst account exists but has 'Read' permission revoked for documentation section
User is logged into knowledge base system with restricted account
Validation error documentation exists and is published
Permission enforcement is active on the knowledge base system

steps.action: Navigate to knowledge base homepage after login
steps.expectedResult: Homepage loads but 'Documentation' menu item is either grayed out or shows a lock icon

steps.action: Attempt to click on 'Documentation' menu item
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears: 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this content. Please contact your administrator.'

steps.action: Try to access documentation directly by typing URL: '/documentation/validation-errors' in browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Page redirects to error page showing '403 Forbidden' with message 'Insufficient permissions to access this resource'

steps.action: Attempt to search for validation error 'VAL-ERR-1001' using search bar
steps.expectedResult: Search executes but results show message 'No accessible results found' or documentation results are filtered out from search

postconditions: Support analyst remains logged in but cannot access restricted documentation
Access attempt is logged in security audit log with timestamp and user ID
No sensitive documentation content is exposed or cached in browser
Support analyst can contact administrator through 'Request Access' link displayed in error message

negative.title: Verify system behavior when searching for non-existent or invalid validation error code
preconditions: Support analyst is logged into knowledge base with valid credentials and permissions
Search functionality is operational and indexed
Validation error documentation contains 50 documented error codes
Error code 'VAL-ERR-9999' does not exist in the documentation

steps.action: Click on the search bar at the top of knowledge base interface
steps.expectedResult: Search bar activates with cursor ready for input

steps.action: Type invalid error code 'VAL-ERR-9999' into the search bar
steps.expectedResult: Auto-suggest dropdown shows 'No suggestions found' or remains empty

steps.action: Press Enter key to execute search
steps.expectedResult: Search results page displays message: 'No results found for VAL-ERR-9999. Try searching with different keywords or browse documentation categories.'

steps.action: Try searching with malformed error code 'VAL###ERR@@@1001' containing special characters
steps.expectedResult: Search handles special characters gracefully and shows 'No results found' with suggestion to 'Check your search terms and try again'

steps.action: Search for extremely long string of 500 characters in search bar
steps.expectedResult: Search bar either limits input to maximum 200 characters or displays error: 'Search query too long. Please use fewer than 200 characters.'

postconditions: No system errors or crashes occur from invalid search queries
Failed search queries are logged for analysis to identify documentation gaps
Support analyst is presented with alternative search suggestions or popular documentation links
Search functionality remains operational for subsequent valid searches

negative.title: Verify error handling when knowledge base system is unavailable or experiencing downtime
preconditions: Support analyst has valid login credentials
Knowledge base server is temporarily down or unreachable due to maintenance
Support analyst is attempting to access documentation during active support call
Browser has no cached version of the documentation

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to knowledge base URL in browser
steps.expectedResult: Browser displays error page: 'Service Temporarily Unavailable' or 'Unable to connect to server' with HTTP 503 status

steps.action: Click browser refresh button to retry connection
steps.expectedResult: Same error persists with message: 'The knowledge base is currently undergoing maintenance. Please try again in a few minutes.'

steps.action: Check if offline documentation or backup resources are mentioned in error message
steps.expectedResult: Error page includes link or reference to 'Download Offline Documentation PDF' or 'Access Backup Knowledge Base' with alternative URL

steps.action: Attempt to access knowledge base mobile app on smartphone
steps.expectedResult: Mobile app displays error banner: 'Cannot connect to server. Some content may be unavailable.' with option to 'View Cached Content'

postconditions: Support analyst is aware of system downtime and can use alternative resources
System administrators are notified of access attempts during downtime
Downtime incident is logged with timestamp for service level agreement tracking
Support analyst can access cached or offline documentation if available

negative.title: Verify system behavior when documentation content is incomplete or missing critical sections
preconditions: Support analyst is logged into knowledge base with full access permissions
Validation error 'VAL-ERR-4050' exists in documentation but is missing 'Troubleshooting Steps' section
Documentation quality control process has not flagged the incomplete entry
Support analyst has received user query about VAL-ERR-4050

steps.action: Search for and navigate to 'VAL-ERR-4050: Database Connection Timeout' documentation page
steps.expectedResult: Documentation page loads showing 'Error Description' and 'Common Causes' sections

steps.action: Scroll down to locate 'Troubleshooting Steps' section
steps.expectedResult: Section header 'Troubleshooting Steps' is visible but content area shows placeholder text: 'Content coming soon' or is completely empty

steps.action: Look for warning indicator or notification about incomplete documentation
steps.expectedResult: Yellow banner appears at top of page: 'This documentation is incomplete. Please check back later or contact documentation team for assistance.'

steps.action: Click on 'Report Issue' or 'Feedback' button on the documentation page
steps.expectedResult: Feedback form opens with pre-filled information: 'Reporting issue with VAL-ERR-4050 documentation' and option to describe missing content

steps.action: Check if 'Related Articles' or 'See Also' section provides alternative resources
steps.expectedResult: Related articles section shows 2-3 similar validation errors with complete documentation as temporary workaround

postconditions: Support analyst is aware documentation is incomplete and cannot fully assist user
Feedback is submitted to documentation team for priority update
Incomplete documentation is flagged in system for quality review
Support analyst must escalate ticket or use alternative resources to resolve user issue

negative.title: Verify error handling when support analyst session expires while viewing documentation
preconditions: Support analyst is logged into knowledge base with active session
Session timeout is set to 30 minutes of inactivity
Support analyst has validation error documentation page open
Support analyst has been inactive for 31 minutes while on support call

steps.action: After 31 minutes of inactivity, attempt to click on another validation error link in the documentation
steps.expectedResult: Page does not navigate and modal popup appears: 'Your session has expired for security reasons. Please log in again to continue.'

steps.action: Try to use the search functionality in the expired session
steps.expectedResult: Search bar is disabled or clicking it triggers the same session expiration message

steps.action: Click 'Log In Again' button in the session expiration modal
steps.expectedResult: User is redirected to login page with message: 'Session expired. Please enter your credentials.' and return URL is preserved

steps.action: Enter valid credentials and click 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Login succeeds and user is automatically redirected back to the validation error documentation page they were viewing

steps.action: Verify that the previous page state and scroll position are restored
steps.expectedResult: User returns to the same documentation page but scroll position may reset to top of page

postconditions: Support analyst is logged back in with new active session
Session timeout counter resets to 30 minutes
No data loss occurs and documentation remains accessible
Session expiration event is logged in security audit trail

negative.title: Verify system handles concurrent access when multiple support analysts access same documentation simultaneously
preconditions: 10 support analysts are logged into knowledge base simultaneously
All analysts are attempting to access 'VAL-ERR-1001' documentation at the same time
Knowledge base server has load balancing configured
System is under moderate load with 100 concurrent users

steps.action: Have all 10 support analysts click on 'VAL-ERR-1001' documentation link simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: All 10 analysts successfully load the documentation page within 3 seconds without errors

steps.action: Monitor server response time and page load performance
steps.expectedResult: Page load time remains under 3 seconds for all users with no timeout errors or 'Server busy' messages

steps.action: Have all analysts perform search queries for different validation errors at the same time
steps.expectedResult: Search functionality responds normally for all users with results appearing within 2 seconds

steps.action: Check if any analysts receive error messages like 'Too many requests' or 'Rate limit exceeded'
steps.expectedResult: No rate limiting errors occur and all analysts can access documentation without restrictions

postconditions: All support analysts maintain active sessions without disconnection
System performance remains stable under concurrent load
Server logs show successful concurrent access without errors
No data corruption or cache conflicts occur from simultaneous access

edgeCases.title: Verify documentation accessibility when knowledge base system experiences high concurrent user load
preconditions: Support Analyst is logged into the knowledge base system
Validation error documentation is published and available
Simulate 50+ concurrent support analysts accessing the same documentation
Network monitoring tools are active to track response times

steps.action: Log into knowledge base system as Support Analyst during peak support hours
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and dashboard loads within 3 seconds

steps.action: Navigate to 'Validation Errors' section in the knowledge base while 50+ users are accessing the same content
steps.expectedResult: Documentation page loads within 5 seconds despite high concurrent load

steps.action: Search for specific validation error code 'VAL-ERR-4032' using the search functionality
steps.expectedResult: Search results return within 3 seconds with relevant error documentation displayed

steps.action: Open the detailed troubleshooting steps for the validation error
steps.expectedResult: Full documentation with troubleshooting steps loads without timeout errors or performance degradation

steps.action: Attempt to copy troubleshooting steps to clipboard for sharing with user
steps.expectedResult: Content copies successfully without formatting issues or system lag

postconditions: Documentation remains accessible and responsive under high load
Support Analyst can continue accessing other documentation without system slowdown
System performance metrics show acceptable response times (<5 seconds)
No error messages or timeout warnings are displayed

edgeCases.title: Verify documentation search functionality with special characters and Unicode in error codes
preconditions: Support Analyst is logged into knowledge base system
Documentation includes validation errors with special characters in error codes (e.g., 'VAL_ERR#001', 'ERR-ÜTF-8', 'ERROR@2024')
Search functionality is enabled and operational
Browser supports Unicode character rendering

steps.action: Navigate to validation error documentation search bar
steps.expectedResult: Search bar is visible and accepts input focus

steps.action: Enter error code with special characters 'VAL_ERR#001' in search field
steps.expectedResult: Search accepts special characters and returns matching documentation without sanitizing the input

steps.action: Search for error code with Unicode characters 'ERR-ÜTF-8'
steps.expectedResult: Unicode characters are properly recognized and matching documentation is displayed

steps.action: Search using error code with @ symbol 'ERROR@2024'
steps.expectedResult: Search handles @ symbol correctly and returns relevant results without treating it as email syntax

steps.action: Copy error code from search results containing emoji '❌ VAL-ERR-500' and paste into new search
steps.expectedResult: Emoji and text are preserved in search, and results are returned accurately

postconditions: All special characters and Unicode are properly handled in search functionality
Documentation with non-standard characters is accessible and readable
Search history preserves special characters correctly
No character encoding errors are displayed

edgeCases.title: Verify documentation usability when validation error list contains 500+ documented errors
preconditions: Knowledge base contains 500+ documented validation errors
Support Analyst is logged in with full access permissions
Documentation is organized with categorization and filtering options
Browser has standard memory allocation (8GB RAM environment)

steps.action: Navigate to 'All Validation Errors' page that lists all 500+ errors
steps.expectedResult: Page loads within 10 seconds with pagination or infinite scroll implemented

steps.action: Scroll through the complete list from first to last error entry
steps.expectedResult: Scrolling is smooth without browser freezing, memory leaks, or performance degradation

steps.action: Apply filter to show only 'Authentication' category errors (subset of 75 errors)
steps.expectedResult: Filter applies within 2 seconds and displays only relevant authentication validation errors

steps.action: Sort the filtered list by 'Most Common' frequency
steps.expectedResult: List re-sorts within 2 seconds showing most frequently occurring errors at the top

steps.action: Use browser's Find function (Ctrl+F) to search for specific error text within the large list
steps.expectedResult: Browser search works efficiently and highlights matching errors without lag

steps.action: Export the complete list of 500+ errors to PDF format
steps.expectedResult: Export completes within 30 seconds and generates a properly formatted PDF with all errors included

postconditions: Large dataset is manageable and navigable without performance issues
Filtering and sorting functions work correctly on large datasets
Browser memory usage remains stable
Exported documentation is complete and usable

edgeCases.title: Verify documentation accessibility when accessed from multiple devices and browsers simultaneously by same analyst
preconditions: Support Analyst has active sessions on desktop (Chrome), laptop (Firefox), and tablet (Safari)
Same analyst account is logged into knowledge base on all three devices
Documentation supports multi-device concurrent access
Network connectivity is stable on all devices

steps.action: Open validation error documentation page on desktop Chrome browser
steps.expectedResult: Documentation loads correctly with full formatting and functionality

steps.action: Simultaneously open the same documentation page on laptop Firefox browser using same login credentials
steps.expectedResult: Second session opens without logging out the first session, documentation displays correctly

steps.action: Open the same documentation on tablet Safari browser while other sessions remain active
steps.expectedResult: Third session opens successfully, all three sessions remain active without conflicts

steps.action: Bookmark a specific error entry on desktop Chrome
steps.expectedResult: Bookmark is saved and accessible from desktop session

steps.action: Check if bookmark syncs to laptop Firefox and tablet Safari sessions
steps.expectedResult: Bookmark sync behavior is consistent with system design (either syncs across devices or remains device-specific with clear indication)

steps.action: Search for different error codes simultaneously on all three devices
steps.expectedResult: All searches execute independently without interference, results display correctly on each device

postconditions: All three sessions remain active and functional
No session conflicts or unexpected logouts occur
Documentation is accessible and functional across all browsers and devices
User experience is consistent across different platforms

edgeCases.title: Verify documentation remains accessible when knowledge base undergoes real-time updates during active support session
preconditions: Support Analyst has validation error documentation open and is actively assisting a user
Documentation administrator is updating error entries in real-time
Version control or change tracking is enabled in knowledge base
Support Analyst is viewing error code 'VAL-ERR-2048' which is being updated

steps.action: Open documentation for error code 'VAL-ERR-2048' and begin reading troubleshooting steps
steps.expectedResult: Documentation displays current version with complete troubleshooting information

steps.action: While documentation is open, administrator publishes an update to the same error code with revised troubleshooting steps
steps.expectedResult: System displays notification banner indicating 'This documentation has been updated. Refresh to see latest version' without disrupting current view

steps.action: Continue reading current version without refreshing to complete assisting the user
steps.expectedResult: Current version remains stable and readable, no content disappears or changes unexpectedly

steps.action: Click 'Refresh' or 'View Latest Version' button after completing user assistance
steps.expectedResult: Page refreshes smoothly and displays updated documentation with change highlights or version indicator

steps.action: Check version history or changelog to see what was modified
steps.expectedResult: Version history shows clear comparison between old and new versions with timestamp and editor information

postconditions: Support Analyst successfully assisted user with stable documentation version
Updated documentation is now visible and accessible
Version control maintains history of changes
No data loss or corruption occurred during real-time update

accessibility.title: Verify complete keyboard navigation through validation error documentation without mouse interaction
preconditions: Support Analyst is logged into knowledge base system
Validation error documentation page is loaded
Mouse or trackpad is disconnected or disabled for testing
Keyboard is the only input device available

steps.action: Press Tab key from browser address bar to navigate into the documentation page
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves to first interactive element (skip navigation link or main navigation menu) with visible focus indicator

steps.action: Continue pressing Tab to navigate through all interactive elements including search bar, filter dropdowns, and error list items
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves in logical order through all interactive elements, focus indicator is clearly visible (minimum 2px outline), no focus traps occur

steps.action: Press Shift+Tab to navigate backwards through the elements
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves in reverse order correctly, all previously focused elements are accessible in reverse

steps.action: Navigate to search field using Tab, type error code 'VAL-ERR-001', and press Enter to search
steps.expectedResult: Search executes successfully, focus moves to search results, results are announced to assistive technologies

steps.action: Use Tab to navigate to first search result and press Enter to open detailed documentation
steps.expectedResult: Detailed documentation opens, focus moves to main heading of the documentation page

steps.action: Press Escape key to close detailed view or return to previous page
steps.expectedResult: View closes and focus returns to the element that triggered the action (search result link)

steps.action: Navigate to filter dropdown using Tab, press Space or Enter to open, use Arrow keys to select filter option, press Enter to apply
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown opens with Space/Enter, Arrow keys navigate options, Enter applies selection, Escape closes without applying

postconditions: All functionality is accessible via keyboard without requiring mouse
Focus order is logical and follows visual layout
Focus indicators are visible throughout navigation
No keyboard traps prevent user from navigating away from any element

accessibility.title: Verify screen reader announces validation error documentation content with proper semantic structure
preconditions: NVDA or JAWS screen reader is installed and running
Support Analyst user is logged into knowledge base
Validation error documentation page is loaded
Screen reader is set to verbose mode for testing

steps.action: Navigate to validation error documentation page and activate screen reader's heading navigation (H key in NVDA/JAWS)
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces all headings in hierarchical order (h1, h2, h3), including 'Validation Error Documentation' as main h1, error categories as h2, individual errors as h3

steps.action: Use screen reader to navigate to search field (E key for edit fields)
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces 'Search validation errors, edit text' with proper label association and field type

steps.action: Navigate through the list of validation errors using screen reader list navigation (L key)
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces 'List with X items' and each error entry with format 'Error code: VAL-ERR-001, Description: [description], list item 1 of X'

steps.action: Activate a validation error link to view detailed troubleshooting steps
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces 'Leaving list, heading level 1: [Error Code and Title]' and reads the detailed description with proper semantic structure

steps.action: Navigate through troubleshooting steps using screen reader (Down arrow or Read Next)
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces ordered list 'List with X items' and reads each step as 'Step 1: [action], list item 1 of X' with proper numbering

steps.action: Navigate to any interactive buttons or links using Tab key
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces button/link purpose clearly: 'Copy error code, button' or 'View related errors, link'

steps.action: Use screen reader landmark navigation (D key for landmarks)
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces all ARIA landmarks: 'Main navigation', 'Search region', 'Main content', 'Complementary information', 'Content information footer'

postconditions: All content is accessible and understandable via screen reader
Semantic HTML structure provides clear content hierarchy
All interactive elements have descriptive labels
ARIA landmarks enable efficient page navigation

accessibility.title: Verify color contrast ratios meet WCAG 2.1 AA standards throughout validation error documentation
preconditions: Validation error documentation page is loaded in browser
Color contrast analyzer tool is installed (e.g., WAVE, axe DevTools, or Colour Contrast Analyser)
Documentation includes various UI elements: text, buttons, links, error indicators, success messages
Testing is performed in both light and dark mode (if available)

steps.action: Use contrast analyzer to check body text color against background color
steps.expectedResult: Contrast ratio is at least 4.5:1 for normal text (under 18pt or 14pt bold) meeting WCAG AA standard

steps.action: Check heading text (h1, h2, h3) contrast ratios against their backgrounds
steps.expectedResult: Large text (18pt+ or 14pt+ bold) has minimum 3:1 contrast ratio, preferably 4.5:1 for AA compliance

steps.action: Analyze link text color contrast in default, hover, focus, and visited states
steps.expectedResult: All link states maintain minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio, links are distinguishable from surrounding text without relying solely on color (underline or other indicator present)

steps.action: Check error indicator colors (red warnings, validation error highlights) against backgrounds
steps.expectedResult: Error indicators have 3:1 contrast ratio for UI components and do not rely solely on color (icons or text labels accompany color coding)

steps.action: Verify button text and background color combinations for primary, secondary, and disabled states
steps.expectedResult: Button text has 4.5:1 contrast against button background, button has 3:1 contrast against page background, disabled buttons are clearly distinguishable

steps.action: Test focus indicators on all interactive elements for color contrast
steps.expectedResult: Focus indicators have minimum 3:1 contrast ratio against adjacent colors and are clearly visible

steps.action: If dark mode is available, switch to dark mode and repeat contrast checks for all elements
steps.expectedResult: Dark mode maintains same WCAG AA contrast standards (4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for UI components)

postconditions: All text content meets WCAG 2.1 AA contrast requirements (4.5:1)
UI components and interactive elements meet 3:1 contrast ratio
Information is not conveyed by color alone
Documentation is readable for users with color vision deficiencies

accessibility.title: Verify documentation remains functional and readable at 200% browser zoom level
preconditions: Support Analyst is logged into knowledge base system
Validation error documentation page is loaded at 100% zoom (default)
Browser is set to standard viewport size (1920x1080 or 1366x768)
Browser zoom functionality is available (Ctrl/Cmd + or - keys)

steps.action: Set browser zoom to 100% and verify documentation displays correctly as baseline
steps.expectedResult: All content is visible, readable, and properly formatted at default zoom level

steps.action: Increase browser zoom to 150% using Ctrl/Cmd and + key
steps.expectedResult: Content reflows appropriately, no horizontal scrolling required, all text remains readable, no content overlap occurs

steps.action: Increase browser zoom to 200% (WCAG 2.1 requirement)
steps.expectedResult: All content remains accessible without horizontal scrolling, text reflows within viewport, no content is cut off or hidden, all functionality remains operational

steps.action: Navigate through documentation using keyboard at 200% zoom
steps.expectedResult: Focus indicators remain visible, Tab navigation works correctly, focused elements scroll into view automatically

steps.action: Use search functionality at 200% zoom: enter search term and view results
steps.expectedResult: Search field is fully visible and functional, search results display without layout breaking, results are readable and clickable

steps.action: Open detailed troubleshooting steps for a validation error at 200% zoom
steps.expectedResult: Modal or detail view opens correctly, all content is readable, close button is visible and accessible, no content overflow issues

steps.action: Test responsive behavior by resizing browser window at 200% zoom
steps.expectedResult: Content continues to reflow appropriately, mobile/responsive breakpoints trigger correctly, no loss of functionality

postconditions: Documentation meets WCAG 2.1 Level AA requirement for 200% zoom
No horizontal scrolling is required at 200% zoom
All functionality remains accessible at increased zoom levels
Content reflow maintains readability and usability

accessibility.title: Verify ARIA live regions announce dynamic content updates for real-time documentation changes
preconditions: Screen reader (NVDA or JAWS) is active and running
Support Analyst is logged into knowledge base with documentation page open
Documentation system supports real-time updates and notifications
ARIA live regions are implemented for dynamic content

steps.action: Have documentation page open while administrator publishes a new validation error entry
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces 'New validation error added: [Error Code]' via ARIA live region without moving user focus

steps.action: Perform a search for validation error that returns results dynamically
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces 'Search results updated, X results found' when results populate, using aria-live='polite' to avoid interrupting user

steps.action: Apply a filter to the error list that updates content dynamically
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces 'Filter applied, showing X of Y errors' without disrupting current reading position

steps.action: Trigger an error state (e.g., network error while loading documentation)
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader immediately announces error message 'Error: Unable to load documentation. Please try again.' using aria-live='assertive' for critical information

steps.action: Receive a notification that documentation has been updated while viewing a specific error
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces 'This documentation has been updated. Refresh to view latest version.' via polite live region

steps.action: Use pagination or 'Load More' functionality to load additional error entries
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces 'Loading more results' followed by 'X additional errors loaded' when content appears

postconditions: All dynamic content updates are announced to screen reader users
ARIA live regions use appropriate politeness levels (polite vs assertive)
Announcements do not interrupt user's current task unnecessarily
Users are aware of content changes without visual cues

accessibility.title: Verify mobile accessibility with touch targets and gesture support for documentation on tablets
preconditions: Support Analyst is accessing knowledge base on tablet device (iPad or Android tablet)
Validation error documentation is loaded in mobile browser (Safari or Chrome)
Touch screen is the primary input method
Device is in portrait orientation initially

steps.action: Measure and verify all interactive elements (buttons, links, form fields) using browser developer tools or touch target overlay
steps.expectedResult: All touch targets are minimum 44x44 CSS pixels (WCAG 2.1 Level AAA) or at least 48x48 density-independent pixels, with adequate spacing between targets

steps.action: Tap on search field to activate keyboard input
steps.expectedResult: Search field activates on first tap, virtual keyboard appears, field is large enough to tap accurately without accidentally hitting adjacent elements

steps.action: Tap on validation error list items to view detailed documentation
steps.expectedResult: List items respond to single tap, no accidental activations of adjacent items, tap area includes entire list item row

steps.action: Use pinch-to-zoom gesture to zoom into documentation content
steps.expectedResult: Pinch-to-zoom works smoothly up to 200%, content reflows appropriately, no horizontal scrolling required after zoom

steps.action: Rotate device from portrait to landscape orientation
steps.expectedResult: Documentation reflows correctly, all content remains accessible, touch targets maintain minimum size requirements, no functionality is lost

steps.action: Test swipe gestures if implemented for navigation (e.g., swipe to go back, swipe between errors)
steps.expectedResult: Swipe gestures work consistently, alternative navigation methods (buttons) are available for users who cannot perform gestures

steps.action: Enable device accessibility features (VoiceOver on iOS or TalkBack on Android) and navigate documentation
steps.expectedResult: Mobile screen reader announces all content correctly, touch exploration works, double-tap to activate functions properly

postconditions: All interactive elements meet minimum touch target size requirements
Documentation is fully functional on mobile devices
Gestures have alternative interaction methods available
Mobile screen readers can access all content and functionality

accessibility.title: Verify focus management and focus trap prevention in modal dialogs and overlays
preconditions: Support Analyst is logged into knowledge base system
Validation error documentation includes modal dialogs or overlay panels for detailed views
Keyboard is primary input method for testing
Screen reader is active for announcement verification

steps.action: Navigate to a validation error entry and press Enter to open detailed view in modal dialog
steps.expectedResult: Modal opens, focus automatically moves to first focusable element in modal (close button or modal heading), screen reader announces modal title and role='dialog'

steps.action: Press Tab key repeatedly to navigate through all focusable elements within the modal
steps.expectedResult: Focus cycles only through elements within modal (focus trap is active), focus moves in logical order through modal content, background content is not accessible via Tab

steps.action: Press Shift+Tab from first focusable element in modal
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves to last focusable element in modal (circular focus trap), does not escape to background content

steps.action: Press Escape key while modal is open
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes, focus returns to the element that triggered the modal (the validation error link), screen reader announces modal closure

steps.action: Reopen modal and click/activate the close button (X or Close button)
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes, focus returns to triggering element, no focus is lost or moved to unexpected location

steps.action: Verify background content is inert while modal is open by attempting to interact with it
steps.expectedResult: Background content has aria-hidden='true' or inert attribute, clicking background does not activate background elements, screen reader does not read background content

steps.action: Test with screen reader virtual cursor to ensure modal boundaries are clear
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces modal beginning and end, virtual cursor navigation is contained within modal, background content is not accessible via virtual cursor

postconditions: Focus is properly trapped within modal while open
Focus returns to logical location when modal closes
Background content is inaccessible while modal is active
Keyboard users can efficiently navigate and exit modal dialogs

performance.title: Knowledge Base Search Performance Under Peak Support Hours Load
performance.description: Validate that the support knowledge base system maintains acceptable response times when multiple support analysts simultaneously search for validation error documentation during peak support hours (simulating 50-100 concurrent users).
preconditions: Knowledge base system is fully populated with validation error documentation
Test environment mirrors production configuration
Baseline performance metrics established (single user response time < 2 seconds)
Monitoring tools configured for response time, throughput, and resource utilization

steps.action: Configure load testing tool (JMeter/LoadRunner) to simulate 50 concurrent support analysts accessing the knowledge base
steps.expectedResult: Load test configuration validated and ready to execute

steps.action: Execute 15-minute load test with realistic search patterns: 60% keyword searches, 30% category browsing, 10% full-text searches for validation errors
steps.expectedResult: Test executes without errors, all virtual users complete their scenarios

steps.action: Gradually increase load from 50 to 100 concurrent users over 10 minutes and maintain for 15 minutes
steps.expectedResult: System scales appropriately, no connection timeouts or 5xx errors

steps.action: Measure and record P50, P95, P99 response times, throughput (requests/sec), error rate, CPU and memory utilization
steps.expectedResult: P50 < 2s, P95 < 4s, P99 < 6s; Throughput > 50 TPS; Error rate < 0.1%; CPU < 70%; Memory < 80%

steps.action: Verify support analyst workflow: search error code → view documentation → access troubleshooting steps completes within SLA
steps.expectedResult: Complete workflow execution time < 10 seconds at P95 under peak load

postconditions: System returns to normal state after load test completion
No memory leaks detected
All performance metrics documented in test report
Response time meets 20% improvement target over baseline
performance.testData: Sample validation error codes: VAL-001 through VAL-100, realistic search queries (e.g., 'email format error', 'date validation failed', 'required field missing')
toolsRequired: Server monitoring tools (CPU, Memory, Disk I/O)

performance.title: Knowledge Base System Breaking Point and Graceful Degradation Validation
performance.description: Identify the breaking point of the knowledge base system by progressively increasing concurrent support analyst sessions beyond expected capacity, and validate graceful degradation and recovery mechanisms when system limits are exceeded.
preconditions: System capacity baseline established (maximum expected load: 100 concurrent users)
Circuit breaker and rate limiting mechanisms configured
Error handling and fallback mechanisms in place
Monitoring and alerting systems active

steps.action: Start with baseline load of 100 concurrent users and incrementally increase by 50 users every 5 minutes until system degradation occurs
steps.expectedResult: Load increases systematically, metrics captured at each increment

steps.action: Monitor response times, error rates, and system resources at each load increment (100, 150, 200, 250, 300+ users)
steps.expectedResult: Clear identification of performance degradation threshold and breaking point

steps.action: Observe system behavior when breaking point is reached: verify error messages are user-friendly, rate limiting activates, and critical functions remain available
steps.expectedResult: System displays 'Service temporarily busy' messages, implements queue mechanism, does not crash or return 5xx errors

steps.action: Validate that read-only access to cached documentation remains available even when write operations are throttled
steps.expectedResult: Support analysts can still view previously accessed documentation from cache during peak stress

steps.action: Reduce load back to normal levels (100 users) and measure recovery time and system stability
steps.expectedResult: System recovers to normal performance within 5 minutes, no data corruption, all services restored

postconditions: Breaking point documented (expected: 200-250 concurrent users)
Graceful degradation mechanisms validated
Recovery procedures confirmed effective
Capacity planning recommendations generated
performance.testData: Mix of simple and complex search queries, various validation error categories, document access patterns

performance.title: Extended Duration Knowledge Base Stability and Memory Leak Detection
performance.description: Execute sustained load test over 8-hour period simulating continuous support operations to detect memory leaks, resource exhaustion, database connection pool issues, and validate long-term system stability under normal operating conditions.
preconditions: System deployed in test environment with production-equivalent resources
Baseline memory and resource utilization metrics captured
Database connection pool configured with monitoring
Automated health checks enabled

steps.action: Configure sustained load of 75 concurrent support analysts (75% of peak capacity) performing continuous knowledge base operations
steps.expectedResult: Load test configured for 8-hour duration with realistic think times (30-60 seconds between actions)

steps.action: Execute soak test with varied operations: search (50%), document viewing (30%), navigation (15%), feedback submission (5%)
steps.expectedResult: Test runs continuously for 8 hours without manual intervention

steps.action: Monitor memory utilization every 15 minutes: heap memory, garbage collection frequency, memory growth trends
steps.expectedResult: Memory utilization remains stable (< 85%), no continuous upward trend indicating memory leaks, GC pauses < 1 second

steps.action: Track database connection pool metrics: active connections, connection wait times, connection timeouts
steps.expectedResult: Connection pool remains healthy, no connection exhaustion, wait times < 100ms, zero timeout errors

steps.action: Validate response time consistency: compare P95 response times at hour 1, 4, and 8
steps.expectedResult: Response time degradation < 10% over 8-hour period (Hour 1 P95: 3s, Hour 8 P95: < 3.3s)

steps.action: Verify log file growth, disk I/O patterns, and cache effectiveness throughout the test duration
steps.expectedResult: Log rotation working correctly, disk I/O stable, cache hit ratio > 80%

postconditions: No memory leaks detected
System performance remains consistent over extended duration
Resource utilization patterns documented
Database connection pool stability confirmed
System ready for production deployment
performance.testData: Rotating set of 500+ validation error scenarios, realistic user session patterns, time-distributed query patterns
toolsRequired: APM tool with memory leak detection

performance.title: Sudden Traffic Surge Handling During Major System Outage Scenario
performance.description: Validate system behavior when support analysts experience sudden spike in knowledge base access (from 20 to 150 concurrent users within 2 minutes) simulating major production incident where validation errors affect multiple customers simultaneously, and verify auto-scaling and rapid recovery capabilities.
preconditions: Auto-scaling policies configured (scale-up threshold: 70% CPU, scale-down: 30% CPU)
Load balancer health checks active
CDN and caching layers operational
Baseline performance with 20 concurrent users established

steps.action: Establish baseline load with 20 concurrent support analysts performing normal knowledge base operations
steps.expectedResult: System operating normally, P95 response time < 2 seconds, CPU utilization ~30%

steps.action: Simulate sudden spike: increase load from 20 to 150 concurrent users within 2 minutes (simulating major incident)
steps.expectedResult: Load increases rapidly, auto-scaling triggers detected, new instances provisioning initiated

steps.action: Monitor response times and error rates during spike: measure P50, P95, P99 at 30-second intervals
steps.expectedResult: Initial response time spike acceptable (P95 < 8s during first 2 minutes), error rate < 2%, no complete service outage

steps.action: Verify auto-scaling response: track instance count, load distribution, and time to stabilization
steps.expectedResult: Additional instances provisioned within 3-5 minutes, load distributed evenly, system stabilizes with P95 < 4s

steps.action: Maintain peak load (150 users) for 10 minutes, then rapidly decrease to 20 users within 2 minutes
steps.expectedResult: System handles sustained peak load, scale-down occurs gracefully without disrupting active sessions

steps.action: Validate that cached content serves majority of requests during spike, reducing database load
steps.expectedResult: Cache hit ratio > 85% during spike, database query rate increases < 50% despite 7x user increase

postconditions: System returns to baseline performance after spike
Auto-scaling policies validated effective
No data loss or corruption during rapid scaling
Session persistence maintained throughout spike
Cost optimization: instances scale down appropriately
performance.testData: High-frequency validation error queries simulating incident scenario (e.g., 'payment validation failed', 'authentication error'), mix of cached and uncached content requests
toolsRequired: Apache JMeter with spike test plugins

security.title: Verify validation error messages do not expose sensitive system information or internal architecture details
security.description: Test that validation error messages displayed in the support knowledge base and shown to support analysts do not leak sensitive information such as database schema, internal file paths, stack traces, server versions, or technical implementation details that could aid attackers in reconnaissance activities. This addresses OWASP A01 (Broken Access Control) and information disclosure threats.
preconditions: Support knowledge base system is accessible
Validation error documentation is populated with error messages
Test account with support analyst privileges is available
Sample validation errors from various system modules are documented

steps.action: Access the support knowledge base as a support analyst and navigate to the validation error documentation section
steps.expectedResult: Documentation section loads successfully showing list of validation errors

steps.action: Review each documented validation error message for sensitive information including: database table/column names, SQL queries, file system paths, server hostnames, IP addresses, framework versions, stack traces, internal API endpoints
steps.expectedResult: Error messages contain only user-friendly descriptions without technical implementation details

steps.action: Check error messages for generic vs specific information - verify they provide actionable guidance without revealing system architecture
steps.expectedResult: Messages follow pattern like 'Invalid input format' rather than 'Column user_password in table auth_users failed VARCHAR(255) constraint'

steps.action: Verify that troubleshooting steps do not instruct support analysts to share sensitive system details with end users
steps.expectedResult: Troubleshooting steps focus on user actions and data format requirements, not internal system operations

steps.action: Test error messages with different error codes and categories (authentication, authorization, input validation, business logic) for consistency in information disclosure prevention
steps.expectedResult: All error categories maintain appropriate information boundaries without leaking technical details

postconditions: No sensitive system information is exposed in error messages
Documentation is flagged for review if information disclosure is found
security.testData: Sample validation errors: authentication failures, input format errors, business rule violations, authorization errors

security.title: Verify access control prevents unauthorized users from accessing support validation error documentation
security.description: Test that only authenticated support analysts with appropriate roles can access the validation error documentation in the knowledge base. Verify that regular end users, unauthenticated users, or users with insufficient privileges cannot view or modify this documentation, preventing potential information gathering for attack planning. This addresses OWASP A01 (Broken Access Control) and elevation of privilege threats.
preconditions: Support knowledge base system is operational
Role-based access control (RBAC) is configured
Test accounts available: support analyst, regular user, unauthenticated session
Validation error documentation is published in knowledge base

steps.action: Attempt to access validation error documentation URL directly without authentication (logged out state)
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and user is redirected to login page with appropriate error message

steps.action: Login as a regular end user (non-support role) and attempt to navigate to validation error documentation section
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with '403 Forbidden' or appropriate authorization error, documentation is not visible in navigation

steps.action: Attempt to access documentation via direct URL manipulation, API endpoints, or alternative paths as regular user
steps.expectedResult: All access attempts are blocked regardless of access method

steps.action: Login as support analyst with proper role and access the validation error documentation
steps.expectedResult: Documentation is accessible and fully visible with all troubleshooting steps

steps.action: Test horizontal privilege escalation by attempting to modify another support analyst's session token or user ID parameter to access restricted documentation sections
steps.expectedResult: Session validation prevents access using manipulated tokens or user IDs

steps.action: Verify that support analyst role cannot escalate privileges to administrative functions (edit/delete documentation) unless explicitly authorized
steps.expectedResult: Support analysts have read-only access unless granted editor role

postconditions: Access control logs are generated for all access attempts
Unauthorized access attempts are blocked and logged for security monitoring
toolsRequired: Multiple test accounts with different roles
Browser developer tools for URL manipulation
Proxy tool (Burp Suite/OWASP ZAP) for request manipulation

security.title: Test knowledge base search and documentation fields for injection vulnerabilities (XSS, SQL, Command)
security.description: Verify that the support knowledge base system properly sanitizes and validates all input fields including search functionality, error message content, troubleshooting steps, and any user-contributed content. Test for Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), SQL Injection, and Command Injection vulnerabilities that could compromise the knowledge base or support analyst sessions. This addresses OWASP A03 (Injection) threats.
preconditions: Support knowledge base system is accessible
Search functionality is available
Test support analyst account is available
Documentation update/edit functionality exists (if applicable)

steps.action: Test search field with XSS payloads: , , javascript:alert('XSS')
steps.expectedResult: Input is sanitized, encoded, or rejected. No script execution occurs in search results or error messages

steps.action: Test search field with SQL injection payloads: ' OR '1'='1, '; DROP TABLE validation_errors--, ' UNION SELECT * FROM users--
steps.expectedResult: Input is parameterized or escaped. No database errors exposed, no unauthorized data retrieved

steps.action: If documentation allows updates, test input fields with stored XSS payloads in error descriptions and troubleshooting steps
steps.expectedResult: Content is sanitized before storage and properly encoded on retrieval. No script execution when other analysts view the content

steps.action: Test for command injection in any file upload, export, or system integration features: ; ls -la, | whoami, && cat /etc/passwd
steps.expectedResult: Input validation prevents command execution. System commands are not processed

steps.action: Test for LDAP injection if knowledge base integrates with directory services: *)(uid=*))(|(uid=*, admin*
steps.expectedResult: LDAP queries are properly escaped and parameterized

steps.action: Verify Content Security Policy (CSP) headers are implemented to prevent XSS execution even if sanitization fails
steps.expectedResult: CSP headers restrict script sources and inline script execution

postconditions: All injection attempts are blocked and logged
No malicious code is stored in the knowledge base
Security monitoring alerts are triggered for injection attempts
security.testData: OWASP injection payload lists, XSS cheat sheet, SQL injection test strings

security.title: Verify session management security and protection against session hijacking for support analyst access
security.description: Test that support analyst sessions are properly secured with appropriate timeout mechanisms, secure session token generation, and protection against session hijacking, fixation, and replay attacks. Verify that session tokens are not exposed in URLs, logs, or error messages, and that concurrent session controls are enforced to prevent unauthorized access to validation error documentation.
preconditions: Support knowledge base authentication system is operational
Support analyst test account is available
Session management is implemented
HTTPS is enforced for all connections

steps.action: Login as support analyst and capture the session token from cookies. Verify token characteristics: length (minimum 128 bits), randomness, HttpOnly flag, Secure flag, SameSite attribute
steps.expectedResult: Session token is cryptographically random, minimum 128 bits, with HttpOnly, Secure, and SameSite=Strict/Lax flags set

steps.action: Test session timeout by remaining idle for the configured timeout period and attempting to access validation documentation
steps.expectedResult: Session expires after configured timeout (recommended 15-30 minutes for support systems), user is redirected to login

steps.action: Copy session token to a different browser/device and attempt to access the knowledge base simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: Either concurrent sessions are allowed with proper tracking, or system detects and invalidates suspicious concurrent access

steps.action: Test session fixation by setting a predetermined session ID before authentication and verifying if it persists after login
steps.expectedResult: New session token is generated upon successful authentication, old token is invalidated

steps.action: Logout and verify that session token is invalidated server-side. Attempt to reuse the old token to access documentation
steps.expectedResult: Logout invalidates session completely. Old token cannot be used to access protected resources

steps.action: Check if session tokens appear in URLs, referrer headers, browser history, or application logs
steps.expectedResult: Session tokens are only transmitted in secure cookies, never in URLs or logs

steps.action: Test absolute session timeout (maximum session lifetime regardless of activity) by maintaining activity beyond configured maximum
steps.expectedResult: Session is terminated after absolute timeout (recommended 8-12 hours), requiring re-authentication

postconditions: All test sessions are properly terminated
Session security logs are reviewed for anomalies
No valid session tokens remain active after testing
security.testData: Support analyst credentials, multiple browsers/devices for concurrent session testing
toolsRequired: Burp Suite or OWASP ZAP for session analysis

userStoryObject.title: As Support Analyst, I want to understand validation error messages to assist users effectively
userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:

Support teams must understand validation errors to provide timely assistance.

CURRENT STATE:

Support documentation on validation errors is limited, causing delays in issue resolution.

DESIRED STATE:

Clear error message explanations and resolutions are documented for support use.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:

  • List common validation errors and causes
  • Provide troubleshooting steps
  • Update support knowledge base


USER INTERACTION FLOW:

  1. Support receives user query on validation error
  2. Consult validation error documentation
  3. Guide user through resolution steps


TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:

  • Tools: Support knowledge base systems


OUT OF SCOPE:

  • Validation feature development


SUCCESS METRICS:

  • Reduction in average support response time by 20%
  • Increased first-contact resolution rates
  • Support team satisfaction with provided documentation

Persona: Support Analyst (Support Analyst)
userStoryObject.acceptanceCriteria:
Criteria 1: Support documentation includes detailed validation error explanations

Criteria 2: Troubleshooting steps enable quick user assistance

Criteria 3: Documentation is easily accessible to support staff

Criteria 4: Support team reports improved resolution efficiency
